Wetlands soak up water and store it. During a drought, when there is not much rain, this stored water can help to keep rivers and streams flowing so that animals and plants can stay alive.

Water that is 'in flood' flows so strongly and quickly that it becomes dangerous. It can drown people and animals and it can cause damage to property and also to the environment, through soil erosion. Floodwater slows down when it flows into a wetland, because the wetland is a large area that can hold a large amount of water.

South African municipal water is generally clean and fresh, and safe to drink. How does it get that way? This section tells the story of how water is treated.
Suid-Afrikaanse munisipale water is oor die algemeen skoon en vars en veilig om te drink. Hoe word dit so? Hierdie afdeling vertel die storie van hoe water gesuiwer word.
The water from a tap does not start out clean and fresh. It may come from a river or a dam, or it may even be waste water that was used by a community or in a factory.
Die water vanuit 'n kraan is nie aanvanklik skoon en vars nie. Dit mag uit 'n rivier of dam kom, of mag dalk selfs afvalwater wees wat deur 'n gemeenskap of fabriek gebruik is.
The process of cleaning the water is called water treatment , and the place where it happens is called a water treatment plant .
Die proses om water skoon te maak word watersuiwering genoem, en die plek waar dit gebeur word 'n watersuiweringsaanleg genoem.
So what exactly happens at a typical water treatment plant?
So wat presies gebeur by 'n tipiese watersuiweringsaanleg?
There are five steps (or processes) in the treatment of water. The five processes commonly used to treat water are screening , sedimentation, aeration, settling , and disinfection .

Daar is vyf stappe (of prosesse) betrokke by die suiwering van water. Die vyf prosesse wat algemeen gebruik word om water te suiwer is sifting , sedimentering, deurlugting, uitsakking , en ontsmetting .
Let us look at them in turn.
Kom ons kyk om die beurt na elkeen.
STEP 1: SCREENING
STAP 1: SIFTING
The raw water that arrives at the plant may contain dirt, fish, rubbish, plants and even sewage.
Die ongesuiwerde water wat by die aanleg aankom, mag grond, visse, vullis, plante en selfs riool bevat.

These things are screened out as the water flows into the plant. This means that the water passes through a screen (which is very much like a large sieve), and the solid matter stays behind on the screen.
Hierdie dinge word dan uitgesif soos die water in die aanleg invloei. Dit beteken dat die water deur 'n groot sif gaan, en die vaste materiale bly dan op die sif agter.
After the screening step the water is still dirty, but the large pieces of rubbish have been removed.
Na die siftingstap is die water steeds vuil, maar die groter stukke gemors is verwyder.
STEP 2: SETTLING
STAP 2: UITSAKKING
During this step the raw water is allowed to stand in a large tank called a settling tank .
Gedurende hierdie stap word die vuil water toegelaat om in 'n tenk te staan. Die tenk word 'n uitsakking tenk genoem.
What happens to the dirt when muddy water stands for a long time?
Wat gebeur met die grond as modderige water vir 'n lang tyd stilstaan?
It sinks to the bottom.
Dit sink na die bodem.
When the raw water stands in the settling tank, the medium-sized pieces of solid matter (called sludge ) sink to the bottom of the tank.
Wanneer die deelsgesuiwerde water in die tenk staan, sak die mediumgrootte deeltjies van vaste materiale (wat slik genoem word) neer na die bodem van die tenk.

The raw water at the top is still dirty but now it only contains small pieces of solid matter. The bits of solid matter left are small enough for small organisms (such as bacteria) to eat. This is what happens in the next step of the treatment process.

Die water is steeds vuil, maar bevat nou net klein deeltjies vaste stof materiaal. Die stukkies vaste stof materiaal wat oorbly is klein genoeg vir klein organismes (soos bakterieë) om te vreet. Dit is wat gebeur in die volgende stap van die suiweringsproses.
STEP 3: AERATION
STAP 3: BELUGTING

The raw water now flows into a special tank that contains bacteria. These are useful bacteria, because they help to break down the last little bits of solid matter as well as breaking down any natural soluble pollutants.

Die rou water vloei nou na 'n spesiale tenk wat bakterieë bevat. Hierdie is nuttige bakterieë want hulle help om die laaste bietjie soliede materiaal, sowel as natuurlik oplosbare besoedeling, af te breek.
Since bacteria need oxygen to stay alive and healthy, air is bubbled through the water. This process is called aeration , because the name comes from the word 'air'.
Aangesien bakterieë suurstof nodig het om aan die lewe en gesond te bly, word lug deur die water geborrel. Hierdie proses word belugting genoem.
STEP 4: FILTERING
STAP 4: FILTRASIE

Next, the water flows through a special filter made of layers of sand and gravel, just like the one you designed, only much bigger. The gravel layer of the filter is about 30 cm deep and the sand layer is about 1 m deep! The filtering step removes any remaining particles and most of the bacteria left in the water.

Vervolgens vloei die water deur 'n spesiale filter , gemaak van lae van sand en gruis, net soos die een wat jy ontwerp het, maar net baie groter. Die gruislaag van die filter is omtrent 30 cm diep, en die sandlaag is omtrent 1 m diep. Die filtreringstap verwyder enige oorblywende deeltjies en die meeste van die bakterieë wat nog in die water oor is.

After this step the water is clear, but some germs and bacteria from STEP 3 may still be in the water. Remember that germs and bacteria are small enough to pass between the gaps between sand and gravel.
Na hierdie stap is die water helder, maar kieme en bakterieë van STAP 3 mag nog in die water wees. Onthou dat kieme en bakterieë klein genoeg is om tussen die gapings tussen
STEP 5: DISINFECTION
STAP 5: ONTSMETTING
During disinfection , chemicals are added to the water to kill any surviving germs.
Gedurende ontsmetting , word chemikalieë by die water gevoeg om enige oorblywende kieme dood te maak

Noudat ons die verskillende maniere ondersoek het om 'n eenvoudige stroombaan te bou, kan ons dit in meer besonderhede definieer.
Electric circuits have different components. What does 'component' mean? Look up the definition for component in your dictionary and write it below.
Elektriese stroombane bestaan uit verskillende komponente. Wat beteken die woord "komponent"? Soek die definisie van komponent in jou woordeboek en skryf dit hieronder neer.
A part or element of a larger whole, especially a part of a machine or vehicle.
'n Onderdeel of element van 'n groter deel, veral 'n onderdeel van 'n masjien of voertuig.
A simple electric circuit has at least three components:
'n Eenvoudige elektriese stroombaan bestaan uit ten minste drie komponente/onderdele:
Note that the diagram has an additional component: a bulb holder. Be aware that this obscures the actual connections to the bulb.
Let op dat die diagram 'n ekstra komponent bevat: 'n gloeilamphouer. Wees gewaarsku dat dit die eintlike verbindings met die gloeilamp onduidelik maak of verberg.

Do you think there is something flowing through the bulb when it lights up? When we connect the bulb so that it lights up there is something flowing through the whole circuit. When it does not light up, we have not made a proper or complete pathway for electricity. This flowing `thing' is called electric current. If the bulb lights up, we say there is an electric current in the circuit. The electric circuit is a system for transferring energy. Think again about the circuits that you have constructed so far.

Dink jy daar is iets wat deur die gloeilamp vloei wanneer dit skyn? Wanneer ons die gloeilamp so verbind dat dit aanskakel, dan is daar iets wat deur die hele stroombaan vloei. Wanneer dit nie skyn nie het ons nie 'n korrekte of volledige baan gebou vir die elektrisiteit nie. Die ”ding” wat vloei word 'n elektriese stroom genoem. Wanneer die lig skyn sê ons dat daar 'n stroom in die baan is. Die elektriese stroombaan is 'n stelsel vir die vervoer van energie. Dink weer aan die stroombane wat jy sover gebou het.
What are the conditions for the bulb to light up?
Wat is die vereistes vir die lig om te skyn?
The circuit should have at least all three components as mentioned above. The circuit should be closed. The connections should provide electrical contact (metal on metal).
Die stroombaan moet ten minste al drie bogenoemde komponente bevat. Die stroombaan moet geslote wees. Die verbindings moet elektriese kontak maak (metaal op metaal).

'n Skakelaar word gebruik om 'n elektriese toestel aan en af te skakel. Maar hoe werk dit?

Explain why you think the paper clip and cardboard device can be called a switch.

We already said that a switch is used to turn an electrical device on or off. We can also say that a switch is used to close or open an electrical circuit. When the switch is on, the circuit is closed. An electric current then exists in the circuit. We could also say there is an unbroken electric pathway in the circuit.

Ons het alreeds genoem dat 'n skakelaar gebruik word om 'n elektriese toestel aan en af te skakel. Ons het ook gesê dat so 'n skakelaar gebruik word om 'n elektriese stroombaan oop of toe te maak. Wanneer die skakelaar aan is, is die stroombaan gesluit/voltooi. 'n Elektriese stroom kan dan deur die baan vloei. Ons kan ook sê dat daar 'n ongebroke elektriese baan in die stroombaan is.
When the switch is off the circuit is open. In this case there is no electric current in the circuit. The electric pathway is now broken.
Wanneer die skakelaar af is, is die stroombaan oop. In hierdie geval is daar nie 'n elektriese stroom wat deur die baan vloei nie. Die elektriese baan is nou gebroke/onvoltooid, of oop.

For the following activities, it is best if learners can see the actual components mentioned (different batteries, light bulbs, etc), but if that is not possible, then make reference to the photos included to complete the questions. This will help learners to realise that the circuits they are building in class represent bigger circuits that are all around them in their daily lives, whether it is the circuit in a car or a circuit in a house or the classroom when you turn on the light.

In die volgende aktiwiteite is dit ideaal as die leerders die werklike komponente wat genoem word (verskillende batterye, gloeilampe, ens.) kan sien, maar as dit nie moontlik is nie, verwys na die foto wat ingesluit is om die vrae te voltooi. Dit sal leerders help om te begryp dat die stroombane wat hulle in die klas bou voorstellings is van groter stroombane wat hulle in hulle daaglikse lewens teëkom; of dit nou 'n stroombaan in 'n motor, 'n huis of die klaskamer is wanneer jy byvoorbeeld 'n lig aanskakel.

For some appliances it is very important that the batteries are put correctly into a specific position. Why do you think this is the case? This is because the battery is used to get an electric current in the appliance and in some appliances the electric current can only go in a specific direction through the appliance. To prevent the appliance from being damaged, the battery must be inserted in the correct direction.

Dit is omdat die battery gebruik word om 'n elektriese stroom in die toestel te maak en in sekere toestelle kan die elektriese stroom slegs in 'n spesifieke rigting deur die toestel beweeg. Om te keer dat die toestel beskadig word, moet die battery in die korrekte posisie ingesit word.

In 1879, just over 130 years ago, Thomas Edison invented the first light bulb. Think of the all the changes it has brought to our world today!

The battery is the source of energy. Some of the energy is transported through the electric wires to the thin wire inside the bulb. The thin wire becomes hot and emits (gives off) light. From the thin wire, the energy dissipates to produce heat and light. So, chemical energy from the battery is transferred to the bulb to provide light and heat.

Die battery is 'n bron van energie. 'n Deel van die energie word deur die elektriese drade vervoer na die dun draad in die gloeilamp. Die dun draad word warm en straal lig uit (gee lig af). Die energie word omgesit na hitte en lig in die dun draad. So chemiese energie van die sel/battery word oorgedra na die gloeilamp om lig en hitte te verskaf.

Inside: copper wire, Outside: coloured plastic material
Binne: Koperdraad, Buite: Gekleurde plastiese materiale

Inside: Copper wire is an electrical conducting material. It allows a path for an electric current in a circuit. Energy is transported in the copper wire from a battery to a device. Outside: Coloured plastic is an electrical insulating material. It prevents the transfer of energy to the environment. It is also there for safety purposes to prevent damage or shock if the electric current is large.

Binne: Koperdraad is 'n elektriese geleiermateriaal. Dit verskaf 'n roete vir die elektriese stroom in 'n baan. Energie word in die koperdraad vervoer van 'n battery na 'n toestel. Buite: Gekleurde plastiek is 'n elektriese nie-geleier/isoleermateriaal. Dit verhoed die oordrag van elektrisiteit na die omgewing. Dit is ook daar vir veiligheidsdoeleindes om skade of skok te verhoed indien die elektriese stroom groot is.

When you flick the switch on, a connection is made (and the circuit is closed) meaning the light bulb will light up. When the switch is turned the other way (off), then the connection will be broken and the circuit will not transfer energy, meaning the light bulb will not light up.

Wanneer die skakelaar na die ander posisie beweeg word (af), word die verbinding verbreek en die baan gelei nie meer energie nie. Dit beteken die gloeilamp gaan nie brand

Indien ons 'n rekord wil hou van hoe 'n spesifieke elektriese stroombaan gebou is, kan ons 'n foto daarvan neem. Indien ons nie 'n kamera het nie, kan ons die stroombaan onthou deur 'n skets te maak.

It takes time to draw a sketch like this. It will even take longer if we add more components to a circuit. We could have more than one bulb like in the case of all the lights in your home. There could be also more than one switch. Each light in your home has its own switch.

Dit neem baie lank om 'n skets te maak. Dit sal selfs langer neem indien ons meer komponente in die baan byvoeg. Ons kan ook meer as een gloeilamp hê soos met al die ligte in jou huis. Daar kan ook meer as een skakelaar wees. Elke lig in jou huis het sy eie skakelaar.

All of us do not draw equally well! To save time and to avoid bad sketches, scientists came up with a way of representing the components of a circuit with special symbols. These symbols are used all over the world. It helps scientists, engineers and technicians to draw or record circuits more quickly. It also helps everybody to understand the circuit in the same way.

Nie almal van ons kan ewe goed teken nie! Om tyd te spaar en swak sketse te vermy, het navorsers vorendag gekom met 'n manier om die komponente van 'n stroombaan voor te stel met spesiale simbole. Hierdie simbole word regoor die wêreld gebruik. Dit help navorsers, ingenieurs en tegnici om stroombane vinniger te teken of op rekord te stel. Dit help ook dat almal die stroombaan op dieselfde manier verstaan.

Let op dat in elektriese stroomdiagramme stel ons die drade met reguit lyne voor.

This is a simple and quick way to represent an electric circuit and it should be clear to everyone that this circuit has a battery, a bulb and a switch, all connected with electric wires. Although we draw the wires as straight lines in a circuit diagram, remember that in real life, the wires are not straight. Just think of the electric wires that are attached to the appliances in your home, like to a kettle, a lamp, a vacuum cleaner or a computer.

Hierdie is 'n eenvoudige en vinnige manier om 'n elektriese stroombaan voor te stel, en dit moet aan almal duidelik wees dat hierdie stroombaan 'n battery, 'n gloeilamp en 'n skakelaar het wat alles met elektriese drade verbind is. An electric circuit is a system for transferring electrical energy. It is a complete, unbroken path for electricity.
'n Elektriese stroombaan is 'n stelsel vir die vervoer van elektriese energie. Dit is 'n volledige, ongebroke baan/pad vir elektrisiteit.

Symbolic representation is new to learners at this level. Make it explicit that when we say `in the above circuit' we really mean 'in the actual circuit that this is a diagram of'.

A good electrical conductor is a material or substance that allows an electrical current to pass through it easily. We call the ability to conduct conductivity . Electrical conductors are usually metal because metals generally have high conductivity. Copper is one of the best electrical conductors and this is why it is the most common material used for electrical wiring. Gold and silver are even better conductors than copper, but they are very expensive and only used sometimes.

'n Goeie elektriese geleier is 'n materiaal of stof wat 'n elektriese stroom toelaat om maklik daardeur te vloei. Ons noem die vermoë om te gelei geleidingsvermoë . Elektriese geleiers is gewoonlik metale omdat metale oor die algemeen 'n hoë geleidingsvermoë het. Koper is een van die beste elektriese geleiers en dit is waarom dit die mees algemene stof wat is gebruik word vir elektriese bedrading. Goud en silwer is nog beter geleiers as koper, maar dit is baie duur en word net soms gebruik.

Insulators are non-conducting materials that do not easily allow current to pass through them. This does not mean that current can not pass through them at all. For example, we generally consider air an insulator, however, lightning can cause electric current to pass through air. Similarly, rubber gloves and shoes will protect you from mains electric current, but not from lightning. Examples of insulators are plastic, rubber, and wood.

When two conducting materials make contact, electricity can pass through them. Our bodies are also good conductors of electricity. In Graad 4 het jy geleer dat die Aarde om sy eie eie as draai. Maar wat beteken dit? Verbeel jou 'n lemoen met 'n potlood daardeur gesteek. Kyk na die volgende prent. As jy die potlood tussen jou vingers hou, kan jy die lemoen in die rondte draai. Die potlood is die as van die lemoen.
The Earth does not really have a pencil through it, but it does spin around. We can imagine a big pencil through the middle of the Earth.
Die Aarde het nie werklik 'n potlood daardeur nie, maar dit draai in die rondte. Ons kan ons verbeel dat daar 'n baie groot potlood deur die middel van die Aarde is.
We are on the Earth. Let us imagine we are at the point where you see the red "X" on the orange:
Ons is op die Aarde. Kom ons verbeel ons dat ons op die punt is waar jy die rooi 'X' op die lemoen sien:
Use an orange and do this as a demonstration. You can set up a mirror or a big sheet of white paper, outside, to shine the Sun into the classroom.
Gebruik die lemoen en doen dit as 'n demonstrasie. Jy kan 'n spieël of 'n groot vel wit papier buite die klaskamer opstel om die Son in die klaskamer in te skyn.
Planet Earth (video) http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=thuViaxRd_w&feature=fvwrel
Planeet Aarde (video) http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=thuViaxRd_w&feature=fvwrel

If we are at position X , we move past the Sun. But to us, it looks as if the Sun is moving. The Sun seems to move from the East to the West. The Sun seems to come up (rise) in the East, move across the sky during the day and go down (set) in the West. But the Sun does not actually move.

As ons by die posisie X is, beweeg ons verby die Son. Maar vir ons lyk dit asof die Son beweeg. Dit kom voor asof die Son van oos na wes beweeg. Dit kom op in die ooste, bereik sy hoogste punt in die lug gedurende die dag en gaan onder (sak) in die weste. Maar die Son beweeg nie werklik nie.
What you need
Wat jy benodig

QUESTIONS:
VRAE:
Picture A
Foto A
You are in South Africa. Find South Africa on the globe.
Jy is in Suid-Afrika. Soek Suid-Afrika op die aardbol.
Find South Africa in Picture A.
Soek Suid-Afrika in Foto A.
Was it daytime in South Africa, when the spacecraft took the photo?
Was dit gedurende die dag in Suid-Afrika toe die ruimtetuig die foto geneem het?
Yes, the Sun is shining on South Africa.
Ja, die Son skyn oor Suid-Afrika.
Was is daytime in Saudi Arabia? Hint: Use your globe to find Saudi Arabia and then find it in Picture A to see if it is day or night.
Was dit dag in Saoedi-Arabië? Wenk: Gebruik jou aardbol om Saoedi-Arabië te soek en spoor dit op in Foto A om te sien of dit dag of nag is.
Yes, there is sunshine on Saudi Arabia.
Ja, daar is sonskyn oor Saoedi-Arabië.
Was it day time in Argentina when this photograph was taken? Use the globe to help you locate Argentina. Explain your answer.
Was dit gedurende die dag in Argentinië toe die foto geneem is? Gebruik die aardbol om jou te help om uit te vind waar Argentinië is. Verduidelik jou antwoord.
No, it was night time in Argentina; in the photo, Argentina is on the darkened side of the Earth, and there are lights showing.
Nee, dit was nag in Argentinië; op die foto is Argentinië aan die donker kant van die Aarde en daar is ligte wat skyn.
Now use the globe to locate Brazil. In Picture A, the tip of Brazil is in the sunlight. Is it morning or afternoon in Brazil? Why?
Gebruik nou die aardbol om die ligging van Brasilië te bepaal. Die bopunt van Brasilië is in die Son in Foto A. Is dit oggend of namiddag in Brasilië? Hoekom?
It is morning, because Argentina is moving towards the east and into the part of the Earth that is in the light.
Dit is oggend aangesien Argentinië na die ooste beweeg na 'n gedeelte van die Aarde wat in die lig is.
Picture B
Foto B
Look at Picture B. What part of the Earth is this picture showing?
Kyk na Foto B. Watter gedeelte van die Aarde wys hierdie foto?
Europe and the top of Africa is shown.
Europa en die bo-punt van Afrika.
Can you see the lights on in Italy? When it is dark in Italy, is it still light in Spain?
Kan jy die ligte in Italië sien? Wanneer dit donker is in Italië, is dit nog lig in Spanje?
Yes
Ja
Is it late afternoon or morning in Spain in Picture B?
Is dit laatmiddag of oggend in Spanje in Foto B?
It is late afternoon.
Dit is laatmiddag.
Now that we have looked at some photographs of the Earth as it changes from day into night as the Earth rotates, let's make a model of Earth using our heads to explain this.
Noudat ons gekyk het na sommige foto's van die Aarde soos dit verander van dag na nag soos die Aarde draai, kom ons maak 'n model van die Aarde met gebruik van ons koppe om dit te verduidelik.
MATERIALS:
MATERIALE:
INSTRUCTIONS:
INSTRUKSIES:
Teacher note: They must move their whole bodies round, not just their heads!
Onderwysersnota: Hulle moet hulle hele liggaam in die rondte beweeg, nie net hulle koppe nie!
QUESTIONS:
VRAE:
Which of your cheeks (left or right) represents west? That is where the Sun appears to go down.
Watter een van jou wange (links of regs) verteenwoordig wes? Dit is waar die Sononder gaan.
The learner's right cheek; that is where she saw the Sun disappear.
Die leerder se regterwang; dit is waar sy die Son sien verdwyn het.
Which cheek represents east, where the Sun comes up?
Watter wang verteenwoordig die ooste waar die Son opkom?
Their left cheeks are like the east. You can chalk an "E" on their left cheeks to remind them.
Hulle linkerwange is soos die ooste. Jy kan 'n 'O' met kryt op hulle wange skryf om hulle te herinner.

We see the Sun rise and move across the sky every day, but the Sun does not really move. It only seems that way to us. Actually, Earth is spinning around and around, and we are moving around with the Earth. The Earth takes 24 hours to complete one full rotation.

Ons sien elke dag die Son opkom en deur die lug beweeg, maar die Son beweeg nie regtig nie. Dit lyk net vir ons so. In werklikheid draai die Aarde om en om, en ons beweeg saam met die Aarde in die rondte. Die Aarde neem 24 uur om een volle rotasie te voltooi.

The Earth moves around the Sun. While the Earth orbits the Sun, it is also spinning on its own axis. It spins round 365 times while it completes one orbit of the Sun. That means 365 days pass and we call that a year.

Die Aarde beweeg om die Son. Die Aarde draai om sy eie as terwyl dit om die Son wentel. Dit draai 365 keer terwyl dit een wentelbaan om die Son voltooi. Dit beteken in 365 dae beweeg die Aarde een keer om die Son - ons noem dit 'n jaar.
Short video showing the Sun, Earth and Moon system http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=W47Wa7onrIQ
Kort video wat die stelsel van die Son, Aarde en Maan wys http://goo.gl/cXeog

The Earth is a planet. There are 7 other planets also moving around the Sun. You can see one of the other planets on most evenings, or early in the morning. This planet is called Venus or iKhwezi or Naledi ya Masa . It is not a star.

Die Aarde is 'n planeet. Daar is sewe ander planete wat ook om die Son beweeg. Jy kan een van die ander planete op meeste aande en vroeg soggens sien. Hierdie planeet word Venus of iKhwezi of Naledi ya Masa genoem. Dit is nie 'n ster nie.
Venus also moves around the Sun but its orbit is a smaller circle than Earth's orbit. Venus takes 225 Earth days to go once around the Sun.
Venus beweeg ook rondom die Son, maar sy wentelbaan is 'n kleiner sirkel as dié van die Aarde. Venus neem 225 aarddae om een keer om die Son te beweeg.
The days referred to here are Earth days; Venus has its own day-length but it's very much longer than an Earth day.
Die dae waarna hier verwys word, is dae op Aarde. Venus het sy eie daglengte, maar dit is baie langer as 'n dag op Aarde.
Mars is another planet you can see on some nights. Mars appears as a small, orange dot in the sky. Mars takes 687 Earth days to go once around the Sun.
Mars is 'n ander planeet wat jy sommige nagte kan sien. Mars lyk soos 'n klein oranje kol in die lug. Dit neem Mars 687 aarddae om een keer om die Son te beweeg.
You can also see Mercury, Jupiter and Saturn in the sky, but they are harder to see than Venus and Mars. All the planets seem to move along the same path that the Sun and Moon seem to move.
Jy kan ook Mercurius, Jupiter en Saturnus in die lug sien, maar hulle is moeiliker om te sien as Venus en Mars. Al die planete lyk asof hulle in dieselfde baan as die Son en die Maan beweeg.

Explain to learners using the picture above that all the planets lie on the same plane - as if they were all lying on a plate. The "plane" does not mean an aeroplane; it means a flat surface like the top of your table or a big flat plate. Also, make sure they understand the next concept of this diagram not being drawn to scale - the orbits of the outer 4 planets are much larger than shown here. But, this is difficult to represent using an image in a book as if it were to be drawn to scale, the outer rings would not fit on the page.

Verduidelik met gebruik van die prent hierbo aan leerders dat al die planete op dieselfde vlak lê – asof hulle almal op 'n bord lê. Hierdie vlak verwys na 'n plat oppervlakte soos die blad van jou tafel of 'n groot plat bord. Maak ook seker dat hulle die volgende konsep van die diagram verstaan, naamlik dat dit nie volgens skaal geteken is nie – die wentelbane van die vier buitenste planete is baie groter as wat hier aangetoon word, maar dit is moeilik om 'n skaalvoorstelling te maak in 'n tekening in 'n boek aangesien die buitenste ringe nie op die bladsy sal pas nie.
The orbits of the outer planets are actually much bigger than what is shown in this image. But, if we tried to draw the orbits to scale, they definitely would not fit on this page!

Die wentelbane van die buiteplanete is in werklikheid baie groter as wat dit in die figuur voorgestel is. Maar as ons sou probeer om die wentelbane op skaal voor te stel, sou dit definitief nie op hierdie bladsy ingepas het nie!

In the image of Sophie, her model of the solar system should have all planets on the same plane to be correct. Perhaps ask your learners what Sophie should do to make the model correct if they compare it to the previous diagram of the solar system? She can rotate the rings so that they all lie in the same plane.

In die illustrasie van Sophie moet haar model van die sonnestelsel al die planete op dieselfde vlak hê om korrek te wees. Miskien moet jy jou leerders vra wat Sophie moet doen om die model reg te maak as hulle haar model met die vorige diagram van die sonnestelsel vergelyk. Sy kan die ringe so roteer dat dit almal op dieselfde vlak lê.
Let's make a scale model of the solar system using our bodies to understand what it means to orbit the Sun!
Kom ons maak 'n skaalmodel van die sonnestelsel deur ons liggame te gebruik om te verstaan wat dit beteken om rondom die Son te wentel!

This activity is useful to help learners understand the structure and scale of the solar system, especially how far apart the planets are from the Sun. The activity requires a large open space, such as a school field. The model only uses 9 learners at once, so swap the learners so that each one gets a chance to be one of the celestial bodies. The teacher can be the Sun in the middle and the learners can be divided into 8 groups, each group assigned to a planet. The teacher should note that as each learner/planet revolves around the Sun, he/she also rotates! This is even trickier to get right, but let the learners attempt to do so.

Die aktiwiteit is nuttig om leerders te help om die struktuur en skaal van die Sonnestelsel te verstaan, meer spesifiek hoe ver die planete vanaf die Son is. Die aktiwiteit benodig 'n groot oop spasie soos 'n skoolveld. Die model gebruik nege leerders op 'n keer. Ruil dus die leerders sodat elkeen 'n kans kry om een van die hemelliggame te wees. Die onderwyser kan die Son in die middel wees en die leerders kan in agt groepe gedeel word. Elke groep word aan 'n planeet toegewys. Die onderwyser moet onthou dat terwyl elke leerder/planeet rondom die Son beweeg, hy/sy ook moet roteer! Dit is nogal moeilik om reg te kry, maar laat die leerders dit probeer doen.

INSTRUKSIES:
Explain to learners that on this scale, the nearest star (other than the Sun), would still be 2748 km away!
Verduidelik aan die leerders dat die naaste ster (afgesien van die Son) op hierdie skaal, ongeveer 2748 km weg is!
Hold all the ends of the strings in one hand above your head so that you are like a maypole and the learners will revolve around you.
Hou al die punte van die toue in een hand bokant jou kop sodat jy soos 'n meiboom is en die leerders rondom jou wentel.

Make sure to point out to learners about the length of time it takes each learner to orbit the Sun. When Neptune has completed one revolution, Mercury will have completed many more as it is closer to the Sun. Point out the big gap between Mars and Jupiter - the space between the inner and outer planets. Mention to learners that there is actually a ring of asteroids (giant rocks) that also orbit the Sun in this space.

Maak 'n punt daarvan om aan die leerders die tyd uit te wys wat elke leerder neem om rondom die Son te beweeg. Wanneer Neptinus 'n omwenteling voltooi het, sal Mercurius baie meer omwentelings voltooi het aangesien dit soveel nader aan die Son is. Verwys na die groot afstand tussen Mars en Jupiter – die ruimte tussen die binne- en buiteplanete. Noem ook aan die leerders dat daar in werklikheid 'n ring van asteroïdes (groot rotse) is wat ook in hierdie Ruimte om die Son wentel.
How many hours are there in a day?
Hoeveel ure is daar in 'n dag?
24 hours
24 uur
How many hours pass from sunrise until the next sunrise?
Hoeveel ure neem dit van een sonsopkoms na die volgende sonsopkoms?
24 hours
24 uur
How many days pass between your 10th birthday and your 11th birthday?
Hoeveel dae het verbygegaan vanaf jou 10de verjaardag tot jou 11de verjaardag?
365 days
\(\text{365}\) dae

Teacher note: The answer is actually 365¼ days. When a day is defined in terms of the spinning of the Earth learners will be able to appreciate the quarter of a day as well, and thus an 'extra' day during leap year. '365 days' makes things manageable only for short term.

Onderwysersnota: Die antwoord is in werklikheid \(\text{365}\)\(\frac{\text{1}}{\text{4}}\) dae. Wanneer 'n dag gedefinieer word in terme van die draaiing van die Aarde sal die leerders die kwart van 'n dag ook begryp en dus die ekstra dag gedurende skrikkeljaar. "\(\text{365}\) dae" maak dinge slegs op die korttermyn hanteerbaar.
How many times must the Earth spin around between your birthdays?
Hoeveel keer moet die Aarde om sy eie as draai tussen jou verjaarsdae?
365 times
\(\text{365}\) keer
Which planets have smaller orbits than Earth?
Watter planete het kleiner wentelbane as die Aarde?
Mercury and Venus.
Mercurius en Venus
the orbit of Mars
die wentelbaan van Mars
the orbit of the Earth
die wentelbaan van die Aarde

687 Aarddae

Earth If I lived on Mars, I would have to wait much longer for my birthday. The reason is that _____ is much bigger than _____, and Mars takes _____ to go around the _____ once.
Aarde As ek op Mars geleef het, sou ek baie langer moes wag vir my verjaardag. Die rede hiervoor is dat _____ baie groter as _____ is, en Mars neem _____ om een keer rondom die _____ te beweeg.

If I lived on Mars, I would have to wait much longer for my birthday. The reason is that the orbit of Mars is much bigger than the orbit of the Earth , and Mars takes 687 days to go around the Sun once.

As ek op Mars gebly het, sou ek baie langer moes wag vir my verjaarsdag. Die rede daarvoor is dat die wentelbaan van Mars baie groter as die wentelbaan van die Aarde is en Mars neem 687 dae om een keer rondom die Son te beweeg.

Chapter 2 deals with the rocky crust of the Earth; we aim to teach the children where soil comes from: soil is broken-down rock plus organic matter from plants and animals. However, we can't just teach about the crust because that would leave a hanging question - the crust of what? So we spend a little time looking at what the crust is covering, and so we look at the structure of the Earth.

Hoofstuk 2 behandel die rotsagtige kors van die Aarde; ons doelwit is om leerders te leer waar grond vandaan kom. Grond is afgebreekte rots en organiese materiaal van plante en diere. Ons kan egter nie net onderrig gee oor die kors nie, aangesien dit 'n onbeantwoorde vraag sal laat – die kors van wat? Ons spandeer dus 'n bietjie tyd aan wat die kors bedek en kyk na die struktuur van die Aarde.
You saw the photo of the Earth in at the beginning of Chapter 1. What is on the surface of the Earth? Name all the features (parts) you can think of.
Jy het die foto van die Aarde aan die begin van Hoofstuk 1 gesien. Wat is op die oppervlak van die Aarde? Benoem al die kenmerke (dele) waaraan jy kan dink.
Answers may include land, sea, forests, rivers, deserts, air, clouds. Learners may correctly include animals and people although they cannot see them in the picture.
Antwoorde kan land, see, woude, riviere, woestyn, lug en wolke insluit. Leerders sal dalk ook diere en mense insluit, alhoewel hulle nie in die foto te sien is nie.
What do you think is under the surface?
Wat dink jy is onder die oppervlak?
Answers may include soil, rocks, mines, bones, roots, drainpipes, and many more. Encourage them to think of as many ideas as they can.
Antwoorde kan grond, rotse, myne, bene, wortels,
Look at the picture of a digging machine and imagine you are driving it.
Kyk na die prent van 'n graafmasjien en verbeel jou jy bestuur dit.

The purpose of this drawing task is to make learners grapple with the idea that they are on a ball-shaped Earth. Most learners have no problem with saying that the Earth is shaped like a ball and most have seen pictures of the ball-shaped Earth like Figure 1 . However, this concept is not easy to think about when you are actually standing on the ball. So the question, "what would you find if you could dig a hole right through the ball?", makes them move mentally between the ground they can see and the view of the ball-shaped Earth as seen from Space.

Die doel van hierdie sketstaak is om leerders te laat worstel met die idee dat hulle op 'n balvormige Aarde bly. Die meeste leerders het nie 'n probleem daarmee om te sê dat die Aarde soos 'n bal gevorm is nie, en baie het al foto's gesien van die Aarde wat soos in Figuur 1 soos 'n bal lyk. Die konsep is egter nie so maklik om te begryp as jy op die bal staan nie. Die vraag, "wat kry jy as jy 'n gat regdeur die bal kon grawe?", dwing hulle om in hulle gedagtes te beweeg tussen die grond wat hulle kan sien en die beeld van die Aarde wat soos 'n bal uit die Ruimte lyk.
Geomorphology is the study of the Earth's surface features. If you break the word up it is easier to understand: geo- (earth), -morph- (shape), -ology (study of).

Geomorfologie is die studie van die kenmerke van die Aarde se oppervlak. As jy die woord opbreek, is dit makliker om te verstaan: geo- (aarde), -morf- (vorm), Dink aan die Aarde as 'n sirkel: dan beteken dit die deursnee is die afstand deur die middel van die Aarde. Die deursnee is 12 900 km. Jy kan dit van die diagram aflees. (studie van).
QUESTIONS:
VRAE:
What is under the floor of your classroom?
Wat is onder die vloer van jou klaskamer?
This question is for discussion.
Hierdie vraag is oop vir bespreking.
Imagine that you use the machine to dig as deep as you want. You drive it down into the Earth. What do you find as you go down?
Verbeel jou die graafmasjien kan so diep grawe as wat jy wil hê dit moet. Jy dryf dit onder die grond in. Wat gaan jy kry soos jy afgaan?
Let the learners discuss this before they write. If they cannot write, let them draw pictures of what they think they will find under the Earth.
Laat die leerders dit eers bespreek voor hulle iets neerskryf. As hulle nie kan skryf nie, laat hulle prente teken van wat hulle dink hulle onder die Aarde sal kry.

Make a drawing of yourself, the digging machine and the hole. In your drawing, show (a) the Earth (b) the digging machine with you inside (c) the hole (d) what you find at the deepest part of the hole.
Maak 'n skets van jouself, die graafmasjien en die gat. Wys in jou skets (a) die Aarde, (b) die graafmasjien met jou binne-in, (c) die gat en (d) wat jy by die diepste deel van die gat gaan kry.
Give the learners enough time to think while they make their drawings.
Gee leerders genoeg tyd om te dink terwyl hulle hulle sketse maak.

Look at the learners' drawings but do not correct them. If you give them the right answer, you will stop them thinking about the problem. At the end of the chapter they will get a chance to change their ideas - see Activity: So what is under our feet?

Kyk na die leerders se sketse maar moet hulle nie korrigeer nie. As jy vir hulle die regte antwoorde gee, gaan hulle ophou dink oor die probleem. Aan die einde van die hoofstuk gaan hulle kans kry om hulle idees te verander – sien Aktiwiteit: Wat is onder jou voete?

Some learners' drawings might show the hole going down through soil and rocks and underground water and volcanoes. Other learners' drawings might not show any of these things; it depends on how much general knowledge they have by Gr. 5. Correctness does not matter at this stage: we are raising their curiosity by asking the question "what is deep down under our feet?"

Party leerders se sketse sal dalk die gat wys wat deur grond en rotse, ondergrondse water en vulkane gaan. Ander leerders se sketse sal dalk geen van hierdie dinge hê nie – dit hang af hoeveel algemene kennis hulle teen Graad 5 het. Akkuraatheid is nie in hierdie stadium belangrik nie: ons wil eerder hulle belangstelling prikkel met die vraag "wat is diep onder die grond onder ons voete?"
If they are thinking about that question, then the next section will make more sense to them.
As hulle oor die vraag nadink sal die volgende afdeling meer sin maak.
The deepest mines in the world are in South Africa, in Gauteng. Those mines are 4 kilometres deep and the miners are digging deeper every month.
Die diepste myne in die wereld is in Gauteng, Suid-Afrika. Hierdie myne is tot vier kilometer diep en mynwerkers grawe elke maand al dieper.
When we begin to dig, we first dig though topsoil. Good topsoil is usually a dark colour.
As ons begin grawe, moet ons eers deur die bogrond grawe. Goeie bogrond het gewoonlik 'n donker kleur.
Topsoil is very important for life. As you can see in the picture, plants and animals depend on topsoil.
Bogrond is baie belangrik vir lewe. Soos jy in die prent kan sien, is plante en diere afhanklik van die bogrond.

If we dig deeper, we find subsoil. This layer is often sandy and orange in colour. When we dig even deeper, we come to rock. this layer of rock underneath the soil is called bedrock. Look at the illustration and find the topsoil. Find the subsoil underneath the topsoil and the bedrock at the bottom.

As ons dieper grawe, kry ons die ondergrond. Die laag is gewoonlik sanderig en oranje-kleurig. Wanneer ons nog dieper grawe kom ons by rots uit. Die laag rots onder die grond word die rotsbodem genoem. Kyk na die illustrasie en soek die bogrond. Soek dan die
When we dig through the rock, a few hundred metres deep, we may find different layers of rock. We may even find water in cracks in the rock in some places. We may find coal in a few places.

Wanneer ons deur die rots grawe kan ons moontlik 'n paar honderd meter diep verskillende lae rots kry. Ons kan selfs op party plekke water in die rotskrake kry. Op sommige plekke kan daar selfs steenkool wees.

Deeper down, about a kilometre deep, we may find oil and gas. Still deeper, we will find very hard rock which will feel hot to touch. In very few places in Gauteng and the Free State, we will find rock that has gold in it. Look at the following picture. Can you see a hand cutting a slice out of the Earth?

Nog dieper af, omtrent 'n kilometer diep, kan ons dalk olie en gas kry. As ons selfs nog dieper gaan, sal ons baie harde rotse kry en die rotse sal warm wees as jy daaraan raak. Op 'n paar plekke in Gauteng en die Vrystaat kan ons rotse kry wat goud bevat. Kyk na die volgende prent. Kan jy die hand sien wat 'n stuk uit die Aarde sny?
In the next picture you see what the Earth is like inside.
Die volgende prent wys jou hoe die Aarde aan die binnekant lyk.
Video showing the structure of the Earth http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=acqRoasmxzg
Video wat die struktuur van die Aarde wys goo.gl/YXUFE

People have not really explored deep into the Earth. We live on the rock that is called the crust of the Earth. The crust is the outer layer of the Earth's surface. Find the crust in the previous diagram. The crust consists of rock and soil.

Mense het nog nie regtig baie diep in die Aarde verken nie. Ons leef op die rots wat die kors van die Aarde genoem word. Die kors is die buitenste laag van die Aarde se oppervlak. Soek die kors in die vorige diagram. Die kors bestaan uit rots en grond.

The Earth's crust is about 70 km thick. Humans have only dug as far as 5 kilometres deep, which is not very far at all! If you look at the diagram of the Earth, you cannot even see the hole in the crust because it is so small.

Die kors is omtrent 70 km dik. Mense het nog net 5 km diep gegrawe, wat nou nie juis ver is nie! As jy kyk na die diagram van die Aarde, is die gat so klein dat jy dit nie eers in die kors kan sien nie.
If you dig a hole in the beach sand, what will you find if you dig very deep?
As jy 'n gat op die seestrand sou grawe, wat gaan jy kry as jy baie diep grawe?
You will find rocks, if you dig deep enough. Children who have dug holes in sand will also tell you that sea water flows through the sand and flows into the hole.
As jy diep genoeg grawe, gaan jy rotse kry. Kinders wat al gate in die sand gegrawe het, sal ook vir jou sê dat die seewater deur die sand syfer en in die gat instroom.

If you went down under the sea water, to the bottom of the sea, what would you find down there? Explain what surface you expect to find. Will it be sandy, or rocky, or could you find mud down there? Do you expect to find different layers?

As jy onder die seewater sou afgaan, wat sou jy daar kry? Verduidelik watter oppervlak jy sal verwag om te kry. Sal dit sanderig of rotsagtig wees, of sal jy modder daar kry? Verwag jy om verskillende lae te kry?
Sand near the beach, but further out to sea you find fine mud and under it you find rock.
Sand naby die strand, maar verder uit ter see sal jy fyn modder kry en onder dit rotse.
Far out to sea, far from the beach, the water is very deep. The sea may be many kilometres deep.
As jy ver van die strand af gaan, is die see baie diep. Die see kan kilometers diep wees.

The deepest part of the sea is called the Marianas Trench. It is near the Marianas Islands, south of Japan. You can find this place on the classroom globe or a map. The deepest part of all the oceans is here. It is a trench (like a valley with steep sides) that is 11 kilometres deep. In fact, the trench is so deep that the light from the Sun cannot reach the bottom, leaving it pitch-dark. The water presses down with a pressure that is like the weight of three buses pressing on your thumbnail!
Die diepste deel van die see word die Mariana-trog genoem. Dit is naby die Mariana-eilande, suid van Japan. Jy kan die plek op die aardbol in die klas of op 'n kaart

Three scientists have gone down there in small submarines, and taken pictures and collected rocks. The submarines had bright lights, and the scientists were amazed when they saw animals that live down there. You can see an animal called an anemone in the next picture.

Drie wetenskaplikes het al in klein duikbote daar afgegaan, foto's geneem en rotse versamel. Die duikbote het helder ligte gehad en die wetenskaplikes was verstom oor die diere wat hulle daar sien lewe het. Jy kan so 'n dier, wat 'n anemoon genoem word, in die volgende foto sien.

They found rocks that look like those in photograph. That means the Earth's crust rock lies under the oceans as well as under our feet. The crust is a layer of rock all around the Earth, like the shell of a hard-boiled egg.

Hulle het rotse gekry wat lyk soos dié in die foto. Die kors se rotse lê dus onder die oseaan en ook onder ons voete. Die kors is 'n laag rots reg rondom die Aarde, soos die dop van 'n hardgekookte eier.

If we go deeper than the crust, we go into rock called the mantle . The mantle is the layer that lies underneath the crust. Mantle rock is much hotter than the rock that is found in the crust. The rocks are so hot that they are soft in some places, like toothpaste. The hot rock pushes upwards against the crust. Where there is a weak spot in the crust, the hot rock might burst through. This is how volcanoes erupt. The mantle is 2 900 km thick, so it is still a long way to go down to get to the core.

As ons dieper as die kors gaan, gaan ons in die rots wat die mantel genoem word. Die mantel is die laag wat onder die kors lê. Mantelrotse is baie warmer as die rotse wat in die kors gevind word. Die rotse is so warm dat hulle op party plekke sag is, soos tandepasta. As daar 'n swak plek in die kors is, kan die warm rots dalk deurbars. Dit is hoe 'n vulkaan uitbars. Die mantel is 2900 km dik. Ons het dus nog 'n lang pad om af te gaan na die kern.
Find the mantle in the diagram of the Earth cut open. Mark it with your pencil. How could you get to the mantle? Which way do you have to go?
Soek die mantel op die diagram van die Aarde wat oopgesny is. Merk dit met jou potlood. Hoe kan jy by die mantel uitkom? In watter rigting moet jy gaan?
You would have to dig a very deep hole down into the centre of the Earth.
Jy sal 'n baie diep gat ondertoe na die middel van die Aarde moet grawe.
The core is still deeper than the mantle. It is very hot, as hot as the surface of the Sun, and made mostly of iron.
Die kern is nog dieper as die mantel. Dit is baie warm, so warm soos die Son se oppervlak, en bestaan meestal uit yster.
Iron melts at those temperatures, but the iron is being pressed so tightly by the mantle all around it that it cannot melt.
Yster smelt teen daardie temperature, maar die yster word so styf vasgedruk deur die mantel reg rondom dit dat dit nie kan smelt nie.
QUESTIONS:
VRAE:
What is the diameter of the Earth?
Wat is die deursnee van die Aarde?
Think of the Earth as a circle; then the diameter means the distance across the middle of the Earth. The diameter is 12 900 km. They can read this off the diagram.
Dink aan die Aarde as 'n sirkel: dan beteken die deursnee die afstand deur die middel van die Aarde. Die deursnee is 12 900 km. Jy kan dit van die diagram aflees.
The Earth is really a ball, so how deep can the hole be?
Die Aarde is regtig 'n bal, so hoe diep kan die gat wees?
Only 12 900 km, because after that the hole will come out of the other side of the Earth!
Net 12 900km, want daarna sal die gat aan die ander kant van die Aarde uitkom!
If the digging machine went as far as it can go, what is the last layer of the Earth that it would dig through?
Wat is die laaste laag van die Aarde waardeur die graafmasjien kan grawe as dit so diep gaan as wat dit kan?
It will dig through the crust, but from underneath and then it will come out into the air.
Dit sal deur die kors grawe, maar van onder af en dan sal dit in die lug uitkom.

Which is the best model of the Earth - a loaf of bread, an apple or an avocado? Look at the three pictures below. Which of those is most like the Earth? Explain your answer. Remember that the Earth has a hard crust , a hot sticky mantle and a hot core . Three different possible models of the layers of Earth

Watter is die beste model van die Aarde - 'n brood, 'n appel of 'n avokadopeer? Kyk na die drie prente hieronder. Watter een is die meeste soos die Aarde? Verduidelik jou antwoord. Onthou dat die Aarde 'n harde kors , 'n warm, sterk mantel en 'n warm kern het. Drie verskillende moontlike modelle van die lae van die Aarde

The bread has a crust, but no core. The apple has a peel or skin and a core, but the core is not one solid thing. The avocado has a tough skin or peel, and a solid core, so it is quite a good model of the Earth.

Die brood het 'n kors, maar nie 'n kern nie. Die appel het 'n skil en 'n kern, maar die kern is nie 'n soliede ding nie. Die avokadopeer het 'n harde vel of skil, en 'n soliede kern. Dit is dus 'n goeie model van die Aarde.
Although the model you chose is most like the Earth, it is not exactly the same. In what way is this model not like the Earth?
Alhoewel die model wat jy gekies het die meeste soos die Aarde is, is dit nie heeltemal dieselfde nie. Hoe verskil hierdie model van die Aarde?
One example is that the avocado pip is not hot, but the core of the Earth is very hot.
Een voorbeeld is dat die avokadopeer se pit nie warm is nie, maar die kern van die Aarde is baie warm.

Life on Earth exists on the very thin layer around the planet - the crust. The soil is a thin layer that forms the top part of the crust. Plants need soil to grow in. The plants also use energy from the Sun to grow, and they make the oxygen we and all the animals need to breathe. You already learnt about this in Life and Living.

Lewe op Aarde word onderhou deur 'n baie dun laag om die planeet - die kors. Die grond is 'n dun laag en alle plante het grond nodig om in te groei. Die plante gebruik energie van die Son om te groei en hulle maak suurstof wat ons en al die diere nodig het om asem te haal. Jy het alreeds hieroor in Lewe en Lewende dinge geleer.
INSTRUCTIONS:
INSTRUKSIES:
QUESTIONS:
VRAE:
If you could make a hole into the Earth, through the floor of your classroom, what would you find down in the Earth?
As jy 'n gat in die Aarde deur die vloer van jou klaskamer kon maak, wat sou jy onder in die Aarde kry?
Imagine you have that machine that can dig as deep as you want. You drive this digging machine as far as it can go. What do you find?
Verbeel jou jy het 'n masjien wat so diep kan grawe as wat jy wil. Jy dryf die graafmasjien so diep as wat dit kan gaan. Wat sal jy kry?
Do a new drawing of yourself and the digging machine and the hole. Your drawing must show the hole that the machine makes if you let it go on until it cannot go further.
Maak 'n nuwe skets van jouself, die graafmasjien en die gat. Jou skets moet die gat wat die masjien maak wys as jy dit laat aangaan tot dit nie meer verder kan gaan nie.
The hole will come to of the other side of the Earth.
Die gat sal aan die ander kant van die Aarde uitkom.
Do you think about the Earth the same way you did when you started this chapter? Have you changed your ideas about the Earth?
Dink jy nog oor die Aarde soos toe jy die hoofstuk begin het? Het jy jou idee oor die Aarde verander?

Use the classroom globe to answer this question: If you dug a hole straight down into the Earth from South Africa, and went through the core of the Earth, where would the hole come out? Draw a picture in the space provided.

Gebruik die klas se aardbol om die vraag te beantwoord: As jy in Suid-Afrika 'n gat reguit af in die Aarde begin grawe en jy deur die kern van die Aarde gaan, waar sal die gat uitkom? Teken 'n prent in die spasie verskaf.

Answer: The hole would come out in the Pacific Ocean, near Hawaii, about 26 degrees north of the equator, and about 150 degrees west of the Greenwich meridian. Check this for yourself on your globe. Let the learners work with the globe until they solve this for themselves. However, they are not allowed to poke a pencil into the globe!

Antwoord: Die gat sal uitkom in die Stille Oseaan, naby Hawaii, omtrent 26 grade noord van die ewenaar en omtrent 150 grade wes van die Greenwich–meridiaan. Toets self die antwoord op die aardbol. Laat die leerders met die aardbol werk totdat hulle self die probleem opgelos het. Hulle moenie toegelaat word om gate in die aardbol te steek nie!
Rocks do not last for ever! They seem very hard and indestructible, but are they? Let's have a look.
Rotse hou nie vir ewig nie! Hulle mag dalk hard en onbreekbaar lyk, maar is hulle? Kom ons stel ondersoek in.
Stones are hard. People say that a thing that is made of stone will last for ever. But is this true?
Klippe is hard. Mense sê dat goed wat van klip gemaak is vir ewig sal hou. Maar is dit waar?
MATERIALS:
MATERIALE:
INSTRUCTIONS
INSTRUKSIES:
Find a cement step that everyone at the school walks on. Sweep the step clean and then look carefully at the step.
Soek 'n sementtrap wat almal in die skool gebruik. Vee die trap skoon en kyk dan aandagtig daarna.
Can you see where people put their feet? What has happened there?
Kan jy sien waar mense hulle voete neersit? Wat het daar gebeur?

Find a piece of cement under an outside tap. Look carefully at the cement, where the water falls on it. You might see that the cement is rougher just where the water hits it. The cement has lost little pieces.

Soek 'n stuk sement onder 'n buite-kraan. Bekyk die sement deeglik waar die water daarop val. Jy mag dalk oplet dat die sement growwer is waar die water dit tref. Die sement het klein stukkies verloor.
Find out how long the cement has been there. Perhaps it was put in when the school was built. So how many years did it take to wear away the cement?
Vind uit hoe lank die sement al daar lê. Dit is miskien al ingesit toe die skool gebou is. Hoeveel jaar het dit geneem om die sement te verweer?
The learners have to find out when the school was built.
Die leerders moet uitvind wanneer die skool gebou is.
Find another object that is being worn away. Tomorrow, tell the class what you have found and write what it is below..
Soek nog 'n voorwerp wat verweer het. Kom vertel môre vir jou klas wat jy gevind het en skryf hieronder neer wat dit is.
The learners could report that they found a door edge; corner of building; pencil point; piece of board chalk; bottom of spoon; sole of shoe.
Die leerders kan verslag doen dat hulle die hoek van 'n deur of 'n gebou; 'n potloodpunt, 'n stuk bordkryt, die onderkant van 'n lepel of die sool van 'n skoen gekry het.
What do you think is wearing away the object?
Wat dink jy is besig om die voorwerp te verweer?
Many shoes wear away the step, or many shoulders that rub against the object. Or paper that the pencil rubs on wears away the pencil.
Baie skoene verweer die trap, baie skouers wat teen 'n voorwerp vryf kan dit verweer. Die papier waarop die potlood skryf, verweer die potlood.
When a small bit breaks off the object, where do you think it goes?
Waarheen dink jy gaan 'n klein deeltjie van 'n voorwerp wat afbreek?
Learners may not have the idea that small bits break off. Find out whether they really think this.
Leerders besef dalk nie dat klein deeltjies afbreek nie. Vind uit of hulle regtig so dink.
Are the small bits still lying somewhere, do you think?
Dink jy die klein deeltjies lê steeds êrens?
If they do think of small pieces breaking off, learners may believe the pieces no longer exist. Here we are dealing with conservation of matter, which is a mental operation the learners must develop.

As hulle dink dat klein deeltjies afbreek, kan hulle dalk glo dat die deeltjies nie meer bestaan nie. Ons het hier te doen met die behoud van materie, wat 'n gedagtegang is wat leerders moet ontwikkel.
Make a pile of the pieces and look carefully at them. They look like a pile of sand.
Maak 'n hopie met die deeltjies en kyk mooi na hulle. Dit lyk soos 'n hopie sand.
You are changing the two rocks into sand!
Jy verander die twee rotse in sand!
In nature, rocks turn into sand. But how does it happen?
In die natuur verander rotse in sand. Maar hoe gebeur dit?
We know that we can break big stones into smaller stones. But when we see small stones lying on the ground, it is hard to think how they were broken up.
Ons weet dat ons groter rotse in kleiner rotse kan opbreek. Wanneer ons kleiner rotse op die grond sien lê, is dit egter moeilik om aan hulle te dink as rotse wat opgebreek is.
In nature, rocks break up in many ways. We will look at just three of those ways.
In die natuur breek roste op verskillende maniere op. Ons gaan net na drie maniere kyk.
The volcanic rock known as pumice is the only rock that can float in water.
Die vulkaniese rots bekend as puimsteen is die enigste rots wat in water kan dryf.
1. Bigger rocks break up into smaller rocks
1. Groter rotse breek in kleiner rotse op

Over time, rocks can get cracks in their surface. Water gets into the cracks and causes these cracks to get bigger. Pieces of rock then break off when the cracks get bigger. Smaller and smaller pieces of rock form as the rocks breakup more and more.

Mettertyd kan rotse krake op hul oppervlak kry. Water kom in die krake en maak dit nog groter. Dele van die rots breek af as die krake groter word. Kleiner en kleiner stukke rots vorm soos die rotse al meer opbreek.
Rocks erode to form soil (video). http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=99rGsXc9yWY
Rotse verweer om grond te vorm (video). goo.gl/6Rd6D
2. Water breaks up the surface of rocks
2. Water breek die oppervlak van rotse op
Soil contains a little water. The roots of plants can change this water so that the water becomes an acid. Vinegar is an example of an acid that we use in our everyday lives.
Grond bevat 'n bietjie water. Die wortels van plante kan hierdie water so verander dat die water suur word. Asyn is 'n voorbeeld van 'n suur wat ons in ons alledaagse lewens gebruik.
Acid can work on stones to break them up. The acidic water breaks the surface of the stone and then the stone can break more easily.
Suur kan op klippe inwerk en hulle opbreek. Die suurwater breek die oppervlak van die klip en dan breek die klip makliker.
Rain water can also break up and wear down the surface of stones causing small pieces to break off. We saw an example of this with the water from the tap breaking up the cement.
Reënwater kan ook die oppervlak van klippe opbreek en verweer wat veroorsaak dat klein deeltjies afbreek. Ons het 'n voorbeeld hiervan gesien met water uit die kraan wat die sement opbreek.
3. Stones rub together, and their surfaces break up
3. Klippe vryf teen mekaar en hulle oppervlakkes breek op

Stones rub together when water moves them, or when wind blows them against bigger stones. People and animals walking on a path kick stones and break off little pieces. Small stones become even smaller, and eventually the very small pieces become sand.

Klippe skuur teen mekaar wanneer water hulle laat beweeg or wanneer die wind hulle teen groter klippe vas waai. Mense en diere wat op 'n voetpad loop, skop klippe en breek stukkies af. Klein klippies word nog kleiner en die klein deeltjies word uiteindelik sand.
In real soil this change takes many years. We can make it happen in the classroom in a week. We will use vinegar to represent the acid water in the soil. Look at the picture below.
In regte grond neem hierdie verandering baie jare. Ons kan dit binne 'n week in die klas laat gebeur. Kyk na die illustrasie hieronder.
MATERIALS:
MATERIALE:
INSTRUCTIONS:
INSTRUKSIES:
QUESTIONS:
VRAE:
Draw the brick as it looks on Day 1.
Teken die baksteen soos dit op Dag 1 lyk.
Draw the brick as it looks on Day 14.
Teken die baksteen soos dit op Dag 14 lyk.
How has the brick changed?
Hoe het die baksteen verander?
Has the part of the brick that is above the vinegar changed in the same way as the part that is under the vinegar?
Het die deel van die baksteen wat bo die asyn was op dieselfde manier verander as die deel wat onder die asyn was?
The vinegar moves up the brick and reacts with substances in the brick. you may find white whiskers of a new substance that has formed from the reaction between the brick and the vinegar.
Die asyn beweeg op in die baksteen en reageer met die stowwe in die baksteen. Jy kan dalk 'n paar wit groeisels kry van 'n nuwe stof wat tydens die reaksie tussen die baksteen en die asyn gevorm het.
Have any parts of the brick fallen off to the bottom of the container?
Het enige dele van die baksteen afgeval na die onderkant van die houer?
represents
verteenwoordig
represents the real
verteenwoordig die regte
is not This equipment is a model of rock, not the real rock. The brick _____ a real rock and the vinegar _____ water around the roots of plants.
is nie Hierdie voorstelling is 'n model van 'n rots, dit is nie 'n regte rots nie. Die steen _____ 'n regte rots en die asyn _____ water rondom die wortels van plante.
represents ... represents the real
verteenwoordig ... verteenwoordig die regte

Rocks break down and slowly change into sand. This change needs thousands of years to take place because soil, wind and water do it very slowly. Sand is not soil. More changes must happen to sand before it is soil.

Rotse breek af en vorm stadig maar seker sand. Die verandering het duisende jare nodig om plaas te vind omdat grond, wind en water dit baie stadig doen. Sand is egter nie grond nie. Daar moet nog veranderinge aan sand gemaak word voor dit grond kan wees.
MATERIALS:
MATERIALE:
INSTRUCTIONS
INSTRUKSIES:
QUESTIONS:
VRAE:
What colour is your soil? Use words like "dark brown", "grey" "orange" or "yellow".
Watter kleur is jou grond? Gebruik woorde soos

Draw some of the grains of rock (sand) that you find. Draw any small bits of plants or bits of dead animals that you see in the soil. Draw any small living animals that you find in the soil. Then let them go, outside.

Teken die rotskorrels (sand) wat jy gevind het. Teken enige klein deeltjies van plante of dooie diere wat jy in die grond sien. Teken enige klein lewende diertjies wat jy in die grond kry. Laat hulle dan buite los.
Complete the sentence: Soil has sand but it also has...
Voltooi die sin: Grond het sand, maar dit het ook...
...rock particles, organic matter such as pieces of plants and dead animals, etc.
...rotsdeeltjies, organiese materie soos dele van plante en dooie diere, ens.
We can make soil in a few weeks, but only a small amount of soil.
Ons kan binne 'n paar weke grond maak, maar slegs 'n klein hoeveelheid daarvan.
The class should begin this activity on the first day of the 4th term, because it needs about 3 weeks to be complete.
Die klas behoort hierdie aktiwiteit op die eerste dag van die vierde kwartaal te begin omdat dit omtrent drie weke neem om te voltooi.
In this activity you begin the slow process of making soil. Your class perhaps started your compost column in the first week of the term.
In hierdie aktiwiteit gaan jy die stadige proses begin van grond maak. Jou klas het miskien al julle komposhoop die eerste week van die kwartaal begin.
MATERIALS:
MATERIALE:
INSTRUCTIONS:
INSTRUKSIES:

In the beginning, you might think the compost looks ugly, and is just a lot of rotting food and leaves. It might have a smell. As the weeks go by, you may notice changes in the colour of the compost, and also in the colour and size of the small pieces. You can also see some things begin to grow in the compost. The smell will change. You may also see insects appear from the compost.

Aan die begin lyk die kompos dalk lelik - net 'n klomp verrottende kos en blare. Dit mag dalk sleg ruik ook. Soos die weke verbygaan sal jy sien hoe die kleur en die grootte van die klein stukkies verander. Jy sal sien dat daar goed in die kompos begin groei. Die reuk sal ook verander. Jy kan dalk insekte in die kompos sien.
QUESTIONS:
VRAE:
Did you notice any changes in the compost? Did you see anything begin to grow in the compost?
Het jy enige veranderinge in die kompos gesien? Het jy iets gesien wat begin groei in die kompos?
This is dependent on the activity - possibly fungi.
Afhangende van die aktiwiteit – moontlik fungi.
What happens to the colour of the water that you pour back in every week?
Wat het met die kleur van die water gebeur wat jy elke week teruggooi?
It should get darker and more "muddy" in colour.
Dit behoort donkerder en meer "modderig" te lyk.
What do you think is in the water?
Wat dink jy is in die water?
Possibly fine bits of broken down organic material from the plants and other matter.
Moontlik klein stukkies organiese materiaal wat afgebreek het van plante en ander materie.
Why must you use the same water each week and not take fresh water?
Hoekom moet jy elke week dieselfde water teruggooi en nie vars water gebruik nie?

This is so that you do not lose the nutrients from that water, because if you use fresh water, then you are washing out and losing the fine bits that have been broken up and beginning to form in the compost.
Dit is sodat jy nie die nutriënte uit die water verloor nie. As jy vars water gebruik was jy die meeste uit en verloor jy die klein deeltjies wat opgebreek het en reeds begin kompos vorm het.
Why does the compost column become lower as the days go by?
Waarom word die kompos minder soos die dae verby gaan?
As the days go by, the organic matter is broken down into smaller particles which can pack closer together and take up less space. So the compost column decreases in height.
Die organiese stowwe word opgebreek in kleiner deeltjies wat stywer teenmekaar kan lê en minder spasie opneem. Die kompos verloor dus hoogte.
Where do you think the insects come from?
Waar dink jy kom die insekte vandaan?
Possibly from eggs/larvae that were present on the organic matter before putting it into the compost column.
Moontlik van eiers of larwes wat in die organiese materiaal was voordat jy dit in die komposhoop gesit het.
The grey hairy things that you see growing in the vegetable peels are fungi, and they help to break down the peels. There are many kinds of fungi and they can have different colours.
Die grys harige goed wat jy op die groenteskille sien groei is muf (fungi); dit help om die skille af te breek. Daar is baie verskillende soorte muf (fungi) wat almal verskillende kleure het.

When you see insects in the compost column, they could come from two places. They may be fruit flies that can get in through the air holes, but they may also be hatching from eggs that insects laid in the peels and leaves before you put them into the plastic bottles. Do you remember in the first term when we did Life and Living, we observed the life cycle of fruit flies?

As jy insekte in die kompos sien kon hulle van twee plekke af gekom het. Hulle kan dalk vrugtevlieë wees wat deur die luggate ingekom het, maar hulle kon ook uitgebroei het uit eiertjies wat insekte in die skille of blare gelê het voor jy hulle in die plastiekbottels gesit het. Onthou jy dat ons in die eerste kwartaal in Lewe en Lewende dinge geleer het van die lewenssiklus van die vrugtevlieg?

After about 4 weeks, your compost will be a dark colour and the big pieces will have broken down into small pieces. You can pour out the compost and mix an equal amount of sand with the compost. Now you have made a little soil.

Na omtrent 4 weke sal jou kompos 'n donker kleur wees en die groot dele sal almal in kleiner deeltjies opgebreek wees. Jy kan die kompos uitgooi en gelyke hoeveelhede sand met jou kompos meng. Jy het nou 'n klein bietjie grond gemaak.

Real soil is more complex than this mixture, and the living things in the soil make substances that bind the grains of sand together, or break down the grains into smaller pieces. But for Gr. 5, it is enough to help the learners understand that soil is not just sand.

Regte grond is meer ingewikkeld as die mengsel. Die lewende dinge in die grond maak stowwe wat die sandkorrels aanmekaar bind, of die korrels afbreek in kleiner deeltjies. Vir Graad 5 is dit genoeg dat die leerders verstaan dat grond nie net sand is nie.
When introducing microorganisms, start off with a discussion about them and ask learners whether they think microorganisms are living or not.
Wanneer jy mikro-organismes aan jou klas bekendstel, begin die bespreking deur hulle te vra of hulle dink mikro-organismes is lewend of nie.

When you looked at soil, you found sand grains, small bits of plants and small bits of animals. But there was another group of things you could not see, because they are too small. They are microorganisms. They are living things that, in the soil, change dead plant and animal material into substances that plants can use and absorb through their roots.

Toe jy na die sand gekyk het, het jy sandkorrels en klein deeltjies plante en diere gevind. Daar was nog 'n ander groep dinge wat jy nie kon sien nie, omdat hulle te klein is. Hulle is mikro-organismes. Hulle is lewendig en hulle werk in die grond. Hulle verander dooie plant- en diermateriaal in stowwe wat plante kan gebruik en deur hulle wortels opneem.

If we work hard, we can make a small amount of good topsoil in a term. But a farmer needs good topsoil all over the farm. Nature works all over the Earth but it works very slowly. Nature needs about 1 000 years to make topsoil just 10 cm deep. If rain washes away the topsoil the farmer cannot grow good crops on that land. When the topsoil has been lost due to wind or rain, we say erosion has taken place. Look at the picture below.

As ons hard werk kan ons 'n klein hoeveelheid bogrond hierdie kwartaal maak. 'n Boer het egter goeie bogrond oral op sy plaas nodig. Die natuur werk oral op die Aarde, maar dit werk baie stadig. Die natuur het 'n 1000 jaar nodig om net 10 cm bogrond te maak. As die reën die bogrond wegspoel, kan die boer nie goeie gewasse op die grond laat groei nie. Wanneer die bogrond verlore gaan as gevolg van wind en reën, sê ons erosie het plaasgevind. Kyk na die prentjie hieronder.
Even if the farmer stops the erosion, it will be about 1 000 years before nature can make new topsoil to replace the soil that has been lost.
Selfs as die boer erosie kan keer, gaan dit omtrent 'n 1000 jaar neem voor die natuur nuwe bogrond maak om die grond wat weggespoel het, te vervang.
If there is too little topsoil, then there will be too few plants for animals to eat. This means that all animals depend on the topsoil, even animals like lions that only eat meat.
As daar te min bogrond is, sal daar te min plante wees vir die diere om te eet. Al die diere is dus afhanklik van die bogrond, selfs diere soos die leeu wat net vleis eet.

We can say that lions depend on topsoil for their food, although they do not eat topsoil. Why do lions depend on the topsoil for their food? Explain your answer. Hint: Think back to what you learnt in the first term in Life and Living about food chains.

Ons kan sê dat leeus afhanklik is van die bogrond vir hulle kos, alhoewel hulle nie die bogrond eet nie. Waarom is leeus afhanklik van die bogrond vir hulle kos? Verduidelik jou antwoord. Wenk: Dink terug aan wat jy in die eerste kwartaal in Lewe en Lewende dinge oor voedselkettings geleer het.

Lions eat other animals, such as impala, zebra, giraffe, etc. These animals are herbivores which eat grass and other plants. The plants that these animals eat need topsoil to grow in. So the lions are indirectly dependent on topsoil by their feeding relationships.

Leeus eet ander diere soos Impalas, Zebras, Kameelperde, ens. Hierdie diere is almal herbivore wat gras en ander plante eet. Die plante wat die diere eet het bogrond nodig om te groei. Die leeu is dus indirek afhanklik van die bogrond as gevolg van die voedingsverhoudings tussen plante en diere.
Have you ever noticed how many different colours and textures soil can have? Even if you are just walking around your school grounds, you may come across many different types of soil.
Het jy al gesien hoeveel verskillende kleure en teksture grond daar is? Selfs al loop jy net op jou skoolgrond rond kan jy baie verskillende soorte grond sien.
This is because soil is made up of different particles. These particles can vary in amounts and therefore make up different types of soils.
Dit is omdat daar verskillende deeltjies is waaruit die grond bestaan. Hierdie deeltjies kan in verskillende hoeveelhede teenwoordig wees, daarom is daar verskillende soorte grond.

Some particles are bigger, others are smaller whereas some are in between. A soil sample normally has a lot of particles either bigger, smaller or in between, and has a smaller portion of the other sizes.

Party deeltjies is groter as ander en daar is ook deeltjies wat êrens tussen die grotes en die kleintjies is. 'n Grondmonster het gewoonlik 'n klomp deeltjies wat of groter, kleiner of tussen-in is en 'n klein hoeveelheid wat ander groottes is.
There are 3 main types of particles which make up soil.
Daar is 3 hoofdeeltjies waaruit grond bestaan.
If the soil was formed from a very hard rock, then it has bigger particles, if it was formed from a soft rock then the particles will be smaller.
As die grond uit baie harde rots gevorm het, sal dit groter deeltjies bevat. As dit uit sagte rots ontstaan het, sal die deeltjies baie kleiner wees.
